content: Is there a standard way (I can't find) to detach comment form and comments from the node view and put them in a block? There are a few modules for drupal to to this. Cannot be done with backdrop's core nor contrib module (yet), is it? What I want to achieve is to print the main node content, then a view's block and then the comment form and comments. Thanks.
I don't have an answer but interested in this too.

For now, what I've done is to add every field in a layout for the corresponding node type in the proper order, plus every other block needed, then list the "main content" block at the end. Create a new template file for that node type and get rid of everything in there except by the comments section.

This way I get that effect. It would be nice to be able to add a comment form block and a comments block in the layout page instead of hacking the template file. Couldn't be these comment blocks something provided by core??
I think we split the comments form for the official forums. Check the forum repo, might give some ideas.
